Package io.github.joblo2213.sma.speedwire

Class Speedwire

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • io.github.joblo2213.sma.speedwire.Speedwire
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    public class Speedwire
extends Thread

    Main class for interacting with speedwire devices.

    All devices that use the speedwire protocol send data periodically via UDP Multicast, by default to group 239.12.255.254 on port 9522.

    To join the multicast group and listen for incoming data call the start() method.
    The thread will read all incoming data and parse the telegrams.
    Register callbacks that receive the parsed telegrams from the thread by using onData().
    Callbacks that handle occurring errors or timeouts can also be registered but aren't mandatory.

    Example: 

    
 Speedwire sw = new Speedwire();
 sw.onData(telegram -> {
     if (telegram instanceof EnergyMeterTelegram) {
         EnergyMeterTelegram em = (EnergyMeterTelegram) telegram;

         //log current ingress power of energy meter
         System.out.println(em.getData(EnergyMeterChannels.TOTAL_P_IN));
     }
 });
 //print stacktrace for all occurring exceptions
 sw.onError(e -> e.printStackTrace());
 sw.start;

    To find all devices that support the speedwire protocol in your local network send a discovery request using sendDiscoveryRequest().
    Each device will answer with a DiscoveryResponse that you can listen for using the onData() callback.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Speedwire()
      Construct a new thread for exchanging data with speedwire devices in your local network.
      Automatically determines your host address and uses the default port (9522) and the default multicast group (239.12.255.254).
      Speedwire​(String hostAddress, String multicastGroup, int port)
      Construct a new thread for exchanging data with speedwire devices in your local network.
      In most cases the default constructor (Speedwire()) will better suit your needs.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      InetAddress getHostAddress()
      Returns the host address used for joining the multicast group (your local ip address)
      InetAddress getMulticastGroup()
      Returns the ip address of the multicast group (by default 239.12.255.254)
      int getPort()
      Returns the udp port used for communication (by default 9522)
      void onData​(SpeedwireCallback callback)
      Register a callback that is run when a new telegram is received.
      Multiple callbacks may be registered.
      void onError​(SpeedwireErrorHandler errorHandler)
      Register a callback that is run whenever an error occurs while reading or parsing incoming data
      Multiple error handlers may be registered, registering new error handlers while the thread is running is possible.
      void onTimeout​(Runnable timeoutHandler)
      Register a callback that is run when no data is received for over 5 seconds.
      As most known speedwire devices send data every second this indicates a network error.
      void run()
      Don't touch this!
      void send​(byte[] packet)
      Send any packet of bytes to the multicast group.
      Please make sure the send data does not violate the speedwire protocol as this isn't checked.
      void sendDiscoveryRequest()
      Sends a discovery request to all speedwire devices in the multicast group.
      Every speedwire device will answer this request with a DiscoveryResponse for which you can listen using onData().
      This allows detecting all unknown devices and determining their ip addresses by using Telegram.getOrigin().
      void shutdown()
      Call this method to gracefully shut down the speedwire thread to stop listening for incoming data and close the socket.
      This method does not await the termination of the thread.
      void start()
      Start the speedwire thread.
      This will cause your device to open a socket, join the multicast group and listen for incoming data.
      If for some reason, like network issues, the socket can't be opened the io exception will be logged.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Speedwire

        public Speedwire​(String hostAddress,
                 String multicastGroup,
                 int port)
          throws IOException
        Construct a new thread for exchanging data with speedwire devices in your local network.
        In most cases the default constructor (Speedwire()) will better suit your needs.
        Parameters:
        hostAddress - the ip address of the host (the device you are running this program on) in your local network
        multicastGroup - the ip address of the multicast group to which all speedwire data is send, by default this is 239.12.255.254
        port - the iana registered udp port over which all speedwire data is send and received. Default port is 9522
        Throws:
        IOException - if one of the given addresses isn't a valid inet address or the multicastGroup is not a multicast address.

      • Speedwire

        public Speedwire()
          throws IOException
        Construct a new thread for exchanging data with speedwire devices in your local network.
        Automatically determines your host address and uses the default port (9522) and the default multicast group (239.12.255.254).
        Throws:
        IOException - if your host address couldn't be determined. Then use Speedwire(String, String, int) instead.

    • Method Detail

      • onData

        public void onData​(SpeedwireCallback callback)

        Register a callback that is run when a new telegram is received.
        Multiple callbacks may be registered. Callbacks are allowed to be registered while the speedwire thread is running, although it is advised to register them before calling start().
        The callback will be run on the speedwire thread so avoid blocking or very slow operations.

        Note:
        Telegrams send from your host address will be redirected back by the multicast group and are therefore filtered out. They will not trigger this callback.

        Parameters:
        callback - callback that listens for all incoming telegrams

      • onError

        public void onError​(SpeedwireErrorHandler errorHandler)
        Register a callback that is run whenever an error occurs while reading or parsing incoming data
        Multiple error handlers may be registered, registering new error handlers while the thread is running is possible.
        Parameters:
        errorHandler - errorHandler that listens for all occurring exceptions while receiving or parsing incoming data

      • onTimeout

        public void onTimeout​(Runnable timeoutHandler)
        Register a callback that is run when no data is received for over 5 seconds.
        As most known speedwire devices send data every second this indicates a network error.
        Parameters:
        timeoutHandler - runnable that is run on timeout

      • send

        public void send​(byte[] packet)
        Send any packet of bytes to the multicast group.
        Please make sure the send data does not violate the speedwire protocol as this isn't checked.
        Parameters:
        packet - an array of bytes that will be send to all devices that joined the multicast group.

      • sendDiscoveryRequest

        public void sendDiscoveryRequest()

        Sends a discovery request to all speedwire devices in the multicast group.
        Every speedwire device will answer this request with a DiscoveryResponse for which you can listen using onData().
        This allows detecting all unknown devices and determining their ip addresses by using Telegram.getOrigin().

        More information on speedwire device discovery can be found in SpeedwireDD-TI-en-10.pdf .

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the speedwire thread.
        This will cause your device to open a socket, join the multicast group and listen for incoming data.
        If for some reason, like network issues, the socket can't be opened the io exception will be logged.
        Overrides:
        start in class Thread

      • run

        public void run()
        Don't touch this!
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class Thread

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Call this method to gracefully shut down the speedwire thread to stop listening for incoming data and close the socket.
        This method does not await the termination of the thread.

      • getHostAddress

        public InetAddress getHostAddress()
        Returns the host address used for joining the multicast group (your local ip address)

      • getMulticastGroup

        public InetAddress getMulticastGroup()
        Returns the ip address of the multicast group (by default 239.12.255.254)

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns the udp port used for communication (by default 9522)
